item.description: Buy bags of chips and party nuts for all guests.
Diced cheese, sliced sausage, deep fried stuff. More tasty than chips and nuts, but more expensive.
Custom snacks, hours d'oeuvres etc. Less expansive than finger-food, but more work.
Outsource the food, if you will. The least work, the highest cost.
More than enough beers for everybody. It has alcohol, but is more expensive.
Mix your own drinks. More work, but less expensive than a trainload of beer.
Let some company do the drinks. Least work, highest cost.
A tent on some field somewhere. Roomy, but outdoors.
Give the party in your dormitory. It's home, but there is less room.
Hire a standard party room. Enough room, no outdoor problems. It costs more, though.
The fanciest option. A beautifully decorated ballroom with everything you need.
Write the address on pieces of paper and hand those out.
Take a nice picture of something, or buy one in the store, and write on the back of that. More expensive, but prettier.
Custom shape card. More work, a tad less expensive than the photo option.
Design the card, then let somebody else print it. You pay a lot, but do the least.
